intro: Comesperma sylvestre, commonly known as the forest comesperma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and understoreys. Its botanical features include woody stems and a compact growth habit. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
